metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29540 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Using a redirect embedded into sourceMappingUrls could allow for navigation to external protocol links in sandboxed iframes without allow-top-navigation-to-custom-protocols. This vulnerability affects Firefox for Android < 112, Firefox < 112, and Focus for Android < 112. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
